meanings.sent1: The scientist preexposed the samples to ultraviolet light before conducting the experiment.
meanings.sent2: She always preexposed the film to ensure the perfect shot.
meanings.sent3: The detective preexposed the evidence, revealing the hidden fingerprints.
meanings.sent4: The artist preexposed the canvas with a light sketch before adding the final details.
meanings.sent5: Before baking the cake, the baker preexposed the batter to the right temperature for optimal rise.

meanings.sent1: The preexposed film captured stunning images of the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The preexposed seeds sprouted quickly in the fertile soil.
meanings.sent3: The preexposed students aced the test with ease.
meanings.sent4: The preexposed wood absorbed the stain more evenly.
meanings.sent5: The preexposed fabric retained its vibrant color after multiple washes.
